alert.note: Alert for Knox (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 25 at 6:26AM CDT until June 26 at 5:52AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Nebraska... Ponca Creek At Verdel affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ponca Creek At Verdel. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Urban lowlands near Ponca Creek at Verdel and Lynch can flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 15.2 feet...or 1.7 feet above flood stage. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the last 24 hours was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 6.9 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.3 feet on 02/16/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 930 PM CDT.
